website_summaries.verdict: A solid, comfortable model that’s particularly good for movies, videos, podcasts and audiobooks.
pros: Light and thin with a hinged design to make slipping on the earloops easy
Good fit with glasses and helmets
Average music sound quality but crisp and clear for non-music audio
cons: Not a snug fit, which leads to weak bass and a softer volume
Don’t always stay put during exercise

customer_reviews.title: No good.
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses, hats and don't like earbuds, so my options for headphones are pretty slim. Fortunately, I have a fond history with this style of headphones and thought these would replace another pair that was soon to die. I was mistaken. While these sound perfectly average, the clip is extremely tight and caused me physical pain after an hour or so of casual use. While these may serve as a back up pair for whatever I end up buying to replace them, they definitely won't be my primary 'walking around' headphones. Also, the plug is wider than most. It's the first pair of headphones I've ever had that couldn't fit through the alloted plug space in my phone's case.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My ears thank these!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE IPHONE/LIKE HEADPHONES! They hurt and they never fit in my ears, I also have my tragus pierced so it definetly doesn't help! These are perfect. I had a pair of these in highschool and never found them again until now. They gently but firmly clasp on your ear, if you have larger ears or fly away ears these might NOT work for you but at this price it's truly worth a shot. The sound is clear and it blocks out more surrounding noises then other headphone due to its coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Mead

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones for a good month now. Are they the most sophisticated, best sounding headphones ever produced? No, but they definitely do their job well. I needed to find comfortable headphones that could accommodate my daith piercings; ear buds will no longer go in my ears without disturbing the piercings. These were the perfect solution in trying to find headphones that were comfortable, not huge and squeezing my head, and not resting in my ear canal either. I forget that I have these on most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: ZaleLunata

customer_reviews.title: woud't stay on
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit right. They would push away from my ears. Didn't sound any were near as good as these.  with similar specs but nowhere near the sound quality. Couldn't use them ..... into the trash with them. To be clear though, They may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put on, terrible audio quality
customer_reviews.text: First of all, you get what you pay for so I should’ve been a little more cautious when I decided to purchase these. I read a lot of reviews and figured it was worth a chance at only $12. However, I had and still have a problem actually putting the headphones on. Maybe my head or my ears are shaped differently from other peoples’. The other major problem is the audio quality. Are use these exclusively for listening to the spoken word, never music, and the quality still is lacking. If you’re on a budget you might want to buy these headphones but if you can at all afford a better pair I’d recommend that.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah X

customer_reviews.title: sub-par but you get what you pay for, I returned these
customer_reviews.text: for the price you should know what to expect, I needed to replace a similar pair of Sonys that finally bit the dust. Here's the catch though the Sony pair had a retractable wire which was very compact and nice. The panasonic headphones have an L connection which does not fit into my phone jack with the case on = no good. they are quite slim and fit comfortably but that said there's no real padding and the wire is super thin just not a very good product overall
customer_reviews.author: MikeVertx

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: They do adjust, but not very well. they still want to fall off my ear while I am running and they can readjust on their own after I put them into my ears which is the frustrating part. They're pretty rigid and not very flexible, unlike my previous jogging headphones. You get what you pay for though. I didn't care much about sound quality when I bought these headphones, just wanted something to hear my music out of while I run, so that wasn't really important to me. Cord length is good. Overall, I got what I paid for. Just wish the adjuster things on the headphones worked better with my smaller ears.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Ear pieces slide around too much
customer_reviews.text: If not for the ear pieces sliding around, I'd probably use these more. As is, the adjustable parts are too loose which bother me. There's no point in listening to music to keep me happy if the headphones I'm using to listen move around and fall out...this makes me grumpy, which is the opposite of what listening to music on well-fitting headphones does. I'm keeping them to give to someone I don't like in order to share the frustration with them while pretending to be nice
customer_reviews.author: mirknight

customer_reviews.title: the particular design of this product appears to lends itself to bad entanglements which leads spending inordinate amounts of ti
customer_reviews.text: I am used to buying approx. 4 earphones per year as I am quite hard on them - they come with me to the gym 3-4x/week and on cycling rides. With heavy sweat, the earphones, at times, slip off if/when one tits his/her head. B/c of this issue, I went back to purchasing the Sony sports earphones, although not a true comparable product given the Sony ones don't have the mic which is handy for calls. In addition (and unfortunately), the particular design of this product appears to lends itself to bad entanglements which leads spending inordinate amounts of time disentangling the product before every use (assuming you just throw them in your pocket after use).
customer_reviews.author: adam99

customer_reviews.title: These earbuds stay on when I xercise!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these, and tried them out with my little pocket AM/FM radio, and I LOVE them! They stay in my ears once I put them in, they have good, clear sound, and even match my Neon Green windbreaker! They will be great for my hour long Oregon rainy walks every morning. I like the over the head headband style with the radio built in, but those don’t work under my hood in tge rain. Another thing; I just saw these on a major big-box store for $39.99, Amazon is selling them for a bargain price!
customer_reviews.author: shopper48

customer_reviews.title: They work well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to listen to the tv after my husband went to bed. I stream to my laptop and watch on the couch. I can lay down and use them. Comfort is so so when laying down. Sometimes they don't bother me and sometimes they do. *shrug* I've not been unhappy with them. They do the job and I don't keep my husband awake in the other room. (Noise from the living room seems to travel to our bedroom which is good if you want to hear burglars but not so much if someone is watching television) Update: one of the channels went completely dead after a few months. I would not buy these again or recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: tellulah

customer_reviews.title: Great for what they are
customer_reviews.text: These are simple headphones that hang over the ear. I don't like in-ear buds. I wear these at the gym while I work out, wind the cable and put them in my pocket for the next time. I wear glasses and they are still comfortable. These are not high quality audiophile headphones, but that's not what I bought them for. If you want a good over the ear headphone, try these.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Hans

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, easy to wear
customer_reviews.text: These earphones have a nice flip-up hook that makes them very easy to put on. They are lightweight, with a soft inner padding that is very comfortable to wear, so comfortable that sometimes, eg. after watching an online movie, I forget to take them off because can't feel that I'm wearing them. Also, very inexpensive. Definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Doris E. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: AVOID — Fell apart in under 8 months
customer_reviews.text: While the sound quality is very good, the quality of the materials is cheap and the seller clearly must know it. The ear cushion phone detached from the earphone and cannot be put back on. Without the cushion, the earphones are uncomfortable and become worthless. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to listen to podcasts and audio book as I fall asleep. It's less damaging than ear buds, I can wear just one at a time (important for a side sleeper) no fuzzy felt headband like those flat sleeping headphones. When I wear them in pretty much any context beside lying flat on my side they fall off/the sound is not great. So, I am very glad to have these and if you sleep with headphones on this is probably the least damaging set up you can do, but for jogging, around the house etc. it's not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of similar earphones ears ago, and they fit outside the ear instead of inside, which is healthier for the ear. These fit gently over the back of the ear and do not slip while working out at the gym. When I wear ear buds I developed a stuffy feeling in my ears and have started getting tinnitus. These do not cause that problem. In fact, I ordered 2 additional pair to keep on hand. Note: These are not expensive, high quality, noise cancelling but they are healthier the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Diana J. Larson

customer_reviews.title: A commuting essential
customer_reviews.text: I've used these daily for a year and they're still going strong. I can't really wear earbuds or AirPods (they either don't stay put or make my ears sore), so these have been great when I don't want to carry around a big pair of over-ear headphones. I wear glasses, and the hooks don't interfere. I wrap (not bend) the cord constantly and regularly shove it into a pocket and it hasn't broken yet. The cord does twist and tangle frequently, but this doesn't affect sound quality and is easy to undo.
customer_reviews.author: raeesmerelda

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Clip-on is the only style of earphones I can wear with comfort. I buy a new pair of these every 1 or 2 years. They don't seem to last beyond that, at least if you use them daily with physical activity like I do. (The cord will fray and the sound on one side dies.) The sound is decent and the price is right. I'm not a serious consumer of music, so I'm never looking for high end. My comfort level and the fact that they stay in place while I'm dancing or exercising is what I value, and for that they get good marks.
customer_reviews.author: Starfleet Dropout

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for price
customer_reviews.text: These do exactly what I need. Im able to listen to my meditation app and fall asleep without my ears hurting the next morning. Sound quality can’t really be compared to brands like Bose but its good enough, especially for the price. Volume actually gets louder than my bose soundsport, but sound quality does worsen as well. Gave these 5 stars bc it does the job and priced appropriately. I do agree with other reviews though about making the hooks more flexible to fit the ear better.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my little AM/FM transister
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when the package arrived because it states it's for an iPod, MP3. Well, I have a little cheapy AM/FM transistor from China and was scared it wouldn't work. It does work GREAT! I had the same pair of these ear phones from 10 years ago, back when they were just for radios. After you figure out how to corkscrew it properly around your ear, they do stay on very well and don't slip out like ear buds always do with me. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Sondra

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased these headphones and I love them!!! I can't wear earbuds due to a medical reason, but I also don't like the bulky headphones as an alternative. These clip on earphones are the perfect solution! They only last about 2 years max before they start to tear up, but, since these are very inexpensive, you get what you pay for. I really enjoy the sound quality. It doesn't cancel out the noise around you, but that's never been much of a concern for me. The cord does want to twist some, but I can usually straighten it out again.
customer_reviews.author: SedonaEmerson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: I already have a pair of these and I really like them. I have had theme for about 5 years. They work just as good as they always did but the ear foam cover has worn off, but I ware them anyway. I don't like the ear buds very much, for one thing they won't stay put in my ear. I am going to see if I can find some replacement cover for my old pair which I intend to keep. Who knows how long they will last. I ware them riding my bike and working outside. As far as i'm concerned they are a great buy and have a good sound.
customer_reviews.author: MAX

customer_reviews.title: Not especially comfortable, and despite the adjustable bud position I can't ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for a few months and I have to say, they're entirely average. Not especially comfortable, and despite the adjustable bud position I can't get the sound right in one of my ears. I also really miss having a button on the cord to be able to change music tracks. I would not buy these again, and in fact I'm looking to replace them already. I am trying to manage my expectations since they were not expensive, but I still expected a little bit better performance from one of my favorite brands.
customer_reviews.author: El Barto

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are great. The ear pads are soft and comfortable and ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great. The ear pads are soft and comfortable and the plastic ear "arm" moves to fit comfortably around the ear. They stay in place well while running. Tge chord is an adequate length for attaching to a device in a pants pocket and the cord lays flat when in use. They seem to be pretty sturdy. Tge plastic pieces are flexible so they should not snap or break easily and the ear pad is fitted securely to the speaker component. The only down side is that they rest on you ear somewhat loosely so they don't block out any background noise. Overall, they are what was described and will work well as an alternative to ear buds!
customer_reviews.author: LittleStar

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually writing this a few years too late. For those who don't like earplugs like me, this is a great set of phones right here. It hugs your ears and gives you a nice surround-sound. It doesn't cancel noise, though, but that's what higher-end headphones are for. I used mine for a few years frequently, and it recently broke (one of the phones' wires started to bend and loosened a wire). For the price, it's definitely worth it. If you take care of it better than I did, it might last much longer than a couple of years. If I run out of headphones to use, I might give these a look again.
customer_reviews.author: consumer_american-dream

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable side sleeping headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several styles and these work best for me. Hubby wears C-pap machine and often wakes me up. I use these to listen to sleep music and I can get 8 hours of restful sleep. The only con is that the soft covering comes off and you can’t get it back on. For the price I keep a spare one on hand. Good sound quality and comfortable when sleeping on side.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these so I can cut back on the amount time I use earbud headphones. It was a recommendation by my doctor. My hearing is fine,but it's something to monitor. Also at my job i sit next to a woman that talks really lound and uses the wrong words in t h.c e wrong sentences all the time. It drove me nuts, so that's the other reason I purchased these. Too cover most of the outer part of my ear so I can drown her out. Without loosing my hearing or my mind. Lol🙉
customer_reviews.author: les

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones for 3.5 months (ordered at the end of January) and one of the foam pieces that covers the microphone part is already off. When I put it back on it just pops right off again. I've always used clip-on headphones, but my previous pair of Panasonic lastest longer than this one; so I guess the product quality has gone down over the years. Very disappointed. The only reasons I gave 2 stars instead of 1 star are because the sound quality is good and the other foam piece is still on, but I will need replacement headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Just like my old ones!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair just like this a few years ago and loved them to death; death being when one of the phones speakers went out. After that I tried ear-buds (ouch), a cheap pair of ear-clips (blah :P), then DJ headphones (not convenient for exercise/ on the go: I need to hear) and after scouring the web I found my self back with these guys!! Sound is great, design is lightweight, clips are secure, they fit in my purse, and they stick together via magnet when not in use. I hope they last for a long while....luv em!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: HappyLeopardess

customer_reviews.title: Mine were good for only 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: These are just ok to wear and the sound is fair. The problem with both pairs I have is that the wires from the "splitter" that go to the left and right phones got stiff like coat hanger wire almost. Then the right side started cutting out at the headphone. They should use silicone insulated wire.
customer_reviews.author: Nukedude

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to write home about.
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I didn't spend tons of money on these. The sound quality is really poor. I suppose if you were lying in bed, on your side with them pressed against your ear--they might sound decent in one ear. I don't know about durability because I just received them. I will not be using them again either--They are not for me.
customer_reviews.author: janke

customer_reviews.title: The wire for these are very thin
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * The sound quality seems fine (I'm not an audiophile - I'm just using these to listen to podcasts). * The headphone jack area is usually the most vulnerable part on headphones, and this one has some protection (it's at a right angle and is housed in thick plastic) * Slim profile so probably OK to sleep on your side with these on without too much discomfort Cons: Wire is very thin so prone to tangling and probably breaking (it would be very easy to break an earphone off the wire. I will be surprised if these last 6 months with me pulling them in and out of my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for tv, comfortable, great sound
customer_reviews.text: I am fighting a painful case of swimmers ear caused by falling asleep with earbuds/plugs headphones. The plugs are the worst for this. These earphones are very comfortable, and they sound better than the ear plugs did. I will be able to lay down with these. Hopefully they last a long time. Update: Several months later and these are in excellent condition. They are built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Divina

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones - getting harder to find!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones and re-ordered them recently as they are getting harder to find. I use them for travel and business - placing on headphones to play music. These are 'old style' headphones - they are not noise cancelling, but the sound is great given the size. I particularly love these as they clip gently onto your ear - I can't wear most in-ear phones as they don't fit well and other style of clips on hurt my ear. These are well designed. Don't discontinue making them!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Love these and wear them most nights as I fall asleep. I hate earbuds pushing on my eardrum. My only issue with these is that once the covering comes off the ear part it will go on but not stay on. This is my third pair and that is why. It's kind of annoying but I haven't found anything else that is nearly this comfortable to wear while on my side in bed. The sound quality is good. Love the product I just wish they held up a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight earphones.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This my second pair. I originally bought them so I could block out noise with a rain track in my music app and finally get a solid night's sleep. It works for that, but even better, they are great for listening to audible books for hours at a time. I have Bose earbuds, which have great sound, but can only tolerate earbuds for a couple of hours at a time, and my Bose QC15 headphones can get too warm after hours of use. I was surprised at how good these inexpensive earphones sound.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm tossing them in the trash.
customer_reviews.text: The earphones will not stay in place, and they are painful to wear when you try to adjust them to make them stay in place. I wish I never bought them because I'm going to toss them in the trash. The sound quality is good, but I have small Spock ears, and they won't stay on. When I lay on my back the speaker part falls away from my ear and they hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Sha

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Clear
customer_reviews.text: I hate earbuds, they hurt my ears, but I like to listen to podcasts while doing boring, mindless, wrote tasks at work. These are an excellent alternative to really big headband headphones, small enough to be subtle but they don't have to be jammed into my ears. The sound quality is great- I occasionally take them off while the sound is playing to make absolutely sure it isn't audible to the people around me, it's that crisp and loud. But it isn't! Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Kane

customer_reviews.title: Right side stopped working after five weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I love the previous model [Panasonic RP-HS33] of these but this one did not hold up. I run seven days a week and after five weeks the right side has no sound. Sorry to say I bought four pairs. The sound quality is ok but not great like the Panasonic RP-HS33. Now I have three pairs left to use. I wanted to return them but I exceeded the 30 day policy! I wish I had bought the Panasonic RP-HS33 older model when it was available at Amazon. I did buy some from a third party off Amazon. They have great sound and hold up in sweaty conditions. I posted a review on the Panasonic RP-HS33.
customer_reviews.author: Cigarbuff

customer_reviews.title: Great Product That Stays Put Without Cramming Anything Into Your Ear
customer_reviews.text: I use these to go running and they stay put and have excellent sound quality. I will buy these again if mine get lost or finally wear out. Nice to have something stay put without covering your entire ear or cramming into your ear canal. I can still hear traffic (important!) but also hear my music or podcast. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: You can even wear these laying on your side and they feel great. And so lightweight, yet sound okay.
customer_reviews.text: The best reason to get these are comfort. I own these and also a pair of ear clip-on earphones from Philips. These are so much more comfortable. I lie to wear them listening to music when I fall asleep. The other brand starts to hurt my ears after a couple hours. These don’t. The sound on the two brands is similar. But I just can’t get over how comfortable these ones are. The only thing I wish was that the chord be about 3-4 inches longer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Not Amazed by it’s sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m a runner and headphones like this are part of my daily routine. I usually look for reliable wired headphones when running. I always had the Philips SHS3200BK/37 Flexible Earhook Headphones and they started failing after 4 years of constant wear/tear, sweat and water use. I’m disappointed with this Panasonic model because I was expecting to had better sound than my Philips headphones. I will have to give this product a C grade.
customer_reviews.author: Nestor Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones -- Just be gentle with them!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these headphones a couple of times. Unfortunately it's because they have broken on me a couple times. I feel like it is my fault though, I am not the most gentle with my headphones. They end up getting twisted and knotted which is probably why the connection to the earphones suddenly starts not working great. Like I say, all my fault. However, the quality of sound, price, and the fact I can hide them under my hair at my place of work where they don't want us to wear big headphones but I can't stand earbuds makes them worth it to me. Just take care of them!
customer_reviews.author: Julia B

customer_reviews.title: I used to have a pair of earphones like this but they eventually died
customer_reviews.text: My earbuds were starting to bother my ears. After my workout my ears would be ringing and I don't put my volume up very high. I used to have a pair of earphones like this but they eventually died. I was very happy to find these. They're light weight and stay on while walking on the treadmill no problem. I can't speak to sound bleeding because I go to the gym when it's not crowded (so there's nobody really near me) and there's usually music playing through the loudspeakers. I got white for me and black for my husband so we don't steal each other's!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't last very long (less than a year) before one of the sides stopped working and had to replace. I only use these when running with my small clip-on mp3 player (since that is not Bluetooth compatible)so, these are not used everyday, and still did not last that long. Also, be aware that this has a 'straight' plug in jack --- I was used to ones that had the "L" shape at the end which makes it easier to place the player in pockets (in my opinion).
customer_reviews.author: Moonlitestorm

customer_reviews.title: Sounds OK. I have better.
customer_reviews.text: These clip-on headphones are OK but I prefer my Koss KSC75 clip-on Headphones. This pair of Panasonic RPHS46EK clip-on headphones are super light weight, very slim, and very comfortable to wear. For the price, it's a good deal. The sound is what I don't care for. They provide high and mid range sound but little bass. Very clear sound. When I adjusted the bass levels (higher) in my MP3 player's equalizer, the sound became distorted. Comparing my Koss KSC75 Clip-Ons to these Panasonic Clip-Ons: They are about the same price. The Koss headphones are much thicker and appear to hang on the ear heavier but are not uncomfortable. I prefer the low range capabilities of the Koss headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I love these kind of headphones because I can't stand having things stuck into my ears. It irritates them and also, it's just not good to have that much noise right there inside your ear. I wanted these kind that clip onto your ears because regular headphones tend to fall off my head. These are better, but I wish the clip part was a better fit. They don't feel secure. But I haven't lost them yet and I do still like them.
customer_reviews.author: LizB

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to complain too much about these for the price. I wanted a very inexpensive pair of ear buds that I didn't care what happened to them. These fit the requirements I was looking for. The sound quality is definitely pretty poor. The music is very flat, I would not say they are very comfortable. The fact that they can be adjusted is a nice bonus. If you are looking for great sound or comfort these are not for you but if you want a pair of ear buds that you are not concerned what happens to them, you can't really go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been searching for years for headphones that were lightweight and comfortable enough to wear for hours and even in bed. I hate earbuds and I finally found these. I love them! The only thing they need to make them perfect is a volume control. I paid for these myself, so this is an honest review.
customer_reviews.author: swk247

customer_reviews.title: Newer and Slimmer Isn't Necessarily Better
customer_reviews.text: My much loved Panasonic RP-HS43 finally gave out after many years of regular use. Since that model is now discontinued and the few left were more than I wanted to pay, I settled on the RP-HS46E-K Slims. I wish I hadn't. The sound quality isn't as good and even though they are lighter and slimmer, they aren't as comfortable to put on and wear. These feel like they will fall off at any minute (but haven't) especially while wearing glasses. I'll now go on a search for clip ons with a hinge and better sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre across the board
customer_reviews.text: Average overall. The sound is OK -- flat; soundstage could be a touch better like the Audio-Technica ATH-EQ300M's 16Hz-24kHz of comparable price. Too much plastic; the clip could break easily even with TLC, but noticeably more flexible than the ATH-EQ300M's stiffer, brittle plastic clip. The pivoting clip makes putting on easy, but you must still be extra gentle. Though the cups sit on the ear with adequate width and low pressure and weight, the lightness indicates how small the magnet is to produce the mediocre sound. Cheap as it is, you can find the same Chinese-made sound quality with even cheaper alternatives. Nothing special about this set. If it were not branded, it could easily be a dollar store candidate.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL JONES

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price - if you disregard the slipping cover
customer_reviews.text: These fit OK and the sound quality is decent, yet the foam cover tore away and started slipping off within a few hours of low-intensity, office-sit-down usage. I would have blamed my fumbling fingers or a manufacturing fluke, alas I read numerous reviews from people this happened to, and this occured after net several hours of use with no abuse nor trauma. I decided to send them back (within days of purchasing) but found some superglue and remembered my generally low standards/energy, so they are still with me, crusty with dry glue and working fine for now.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Finally. These aren't perfect, I get some clipping from my phone (may be the phone too) and they aren't that loud because they are not earbuds but who cares because I can lay on my side in these. Seriously that is all I wanted. I don't sleep well and have to go to bed at times while general house noise is still going to be an issue. These are great because I can rest comfortably and naturally with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use them
customer_reviews.text: I could not use these since they could not be plugged into my phone because the shape of the plug blocked the complete insertion. I had no idea this would not fit when I ordered them.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: They're okay
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are just so-so. I bought them because I hoped they would fit like some others I have that are the same type but a different brand, but they really don't fit the same and aren't nearly as comfortable. Sound quality is average. I use them occasionally at work, but wouldn't wear them for long periods of time or when doing an activity, as they just don't fit that well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I don't prefer an earbud that goes inside my ear, but a big headset drives me crazy while trying to exercise. I wasn't certain how well these would stay in place, but for anything shy of a vigorous run, they work perfectly. Even a light jog does little more than jiggle them a bit. The sound quality seems great for the price, and I've been using them for months with no evident wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: cmosier

customer_reviews.title: the noise canceling function is perfect, I had it on max volume and my ...
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly, the noise canceling function is perfect, I had it on max volume and my friend sitting next to me could not hear anything and it was also not overbearing to my own eardrums. Excellent quality and very sturdy item, will not fall off and holds in place perfectly. I also love the fact nothing has to get plugged into my ear and it is a gentle foam like classic headphones style but more sleeker and smaller.
customer_reviews.author: azkr

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Well
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my ears are just weirdly shaped but these didn't feel like they fit at all. I had thebefore and though that this would be a good buy for running, but these earphones really didn't work well. I ended up just going back to the original pair of headphones I have. I have rebought the other pair of Panosonic earphones three times already and plan to just skip this and continue using the other pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: OK comfort, decent sound, holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.text: Earbuds like these are a tricky thing; Trading off sound quality for size and convenience, taking a chance on comfort and durability (although, at this price, it's not too painful if they don't last years). These are a little less comfortable that a few other clip earbuds I have tried, and it took a little while to get used to the wire routing with regards to putting them on. But they are comfortable enough and work well enough that I won't look for something else until these give up the ghost.
customer_reviews.author: dog owner in OK

customer_reviews.title: Solid Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have kept these wound up in my bookbag for some time, now. They still work. These are some solid headphones, with an adjustable fitting that actually affects the size of the headphone, but not to any extreme length. I find the adjustable nature makes them sit more comfortable on my ears. They still work like they were brand new - even after a few years. These tend to help dampen the noise around you, but nothing crazy. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kaneda amuro

customer_reviews.title: Small ears? Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Worst earphones i've bought to be honest. I thought because the brand was panasonic the earphones would be worth buying, but no. When I use them while I am running one side always falls out! It might be my small ears but still, this product doesn't even specify that it is for big ears only? The part that goes in your ear is SO uncomfortable too. I won't even use these as a spare pair, total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Tejeda

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two pairs of these headphones now. I wear them in the gym daily for 2-3 hours each workout, and each pair have lasted just a month or two over a year old. $15 for these "cheap" headphones to last a year is decent in my opinion. The sound quality is one of the best in any headphones I have used for the past decade. The clip is also comfortable on the ear and does not fall off. Debating buying a third pair but getting extra warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Miller

customer_reviews.title: New favorite over-the-ear earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Sony marked up the price on their over-the-ear earbuds that I've been using for a decade. As a result, I bought four different non-sony over-the-ear earbuds to figure out what I'd replace the sony brand with. Of the four non-sony brands, these were my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: bottlecap

customer_reviews.title: very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to report that after so many months of using this product, I'm totally satisfied with my purchase. The sound is great, it did not break so far, I use these Earphones almost every night when I go to sleep. They are quite comfortable and do NOT hurt my ear at all, even when sleeping on the side. Sometimes I fall to sleep with the them on and I have them on all night long. I'd prefer to have volume control somewhere there though.
customer_reviews.author: IBS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Not a good replacement for similarly designed Sony headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using SONY MDRQ22LP headphones as my jogging & home knock-around headphones for years and was looking for a replacement for those after they broke (since Sony discontinued that model). I tried these out, because they have a similar design - but they're quite inferior to the Sony's that I was trying to replace. The feel - They're pretty light and comfortable, but they feel a little flimsy/cheap. They give the impression that they'll break with a slight accidental tug. The sound - they're pretty horrible with bass response. They have a pretty hollow, tinny sound with the distinct lack of low end. Everything sounds kind crunchy and raw, like a black metal recording.
customer_reviews.author: W. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I like to listen to books as I fall asleep but my partner isn't quite into it. With these I can listen and fall asleep without bothering him and without hurting my ear (I only use one so it's great that you can with these) even if I fall asleep on that side. They are not tinny like some cheap ear phones and are outside the ear - much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Crazycat911

customer_reviews.title: Good solution because can't put anything in ears.
customer_reviews.text: update 4.14/18 Third pair I ordered of these the sound cuts out. Also the wiring is very stiff, not very flexible. The previous review was based on my first two pairs. Like the slim design and softness. I'm unable to put anything in my ears so this is a good solution. Difficult to use with glasses but use easily while going to sleep. Purchased the Koss product and hands down this product is so much better. The Koss ones are clunky and difficult to get over my ear so I don't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer KK

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I'm only using these clip on style of earphones and I use this to go to work, I really like the design, very slim, sometimes with traffic and the noise I almost can hear anything but it's worth it in my opinion, not invasive and very stylish in my opinion at least.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: Like working a Rubik's cube
customer_reviews.text: I believe these earbuds were designed by engineers who know the most efficient designs and methods for manufacturing. But I doubt any of those same engineers actually choose to wear this product. The process of getting these over the ear and adjusted to fit and stay in place is like working a Rubik's cube. I've had easy-on-good fit-over-the-ear buds before--from Sony. These are not that. I'm sorry I tossed the packaging. I'll have to consider this purchase a loss.
customer_reviews.author: Billbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought numerous different brands of earbuds/earphones ranging in price from $5-$200 & these are by far my favorite. I have 2 sets that I've had for well over a year - basically one is for outdoor use & the other for indoor use & both pair are still working great! I use my 'outside' pair for when I'm exercising & working in the yard & when cleaning. I have even accidentally dropped them in water & they were fine. They stay in place, don't block out outside noises but still have a clear sound, I highly recommended them & would love for Panasonic to come out with the same kind of design with Bluetooth!
customer_reviews.author: KIMBERLY S.

customer_reviews.title: Functionally comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Highly comfortable and functional. I love that I can wear these while working and tasking and not cut myself off from the outside world. They're not so great in really loud environments though. These are my third pair and I would (will) purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Brando M

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, good sound
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for several weeks now and I'm still happy with it. Comfortable for hours of wear - not something I can say for other headphone designs since I wear glasses (tricky for over ear designs) and my ears don't like having buds in them. The sound quality is better than my previous cheap pair of headphones, too - I can leave the sound turned way down on my laptop and still hear everything fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel

customer_reviews.title: Love these. I’ve had 2 pairs because I lost ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I’ve had 2 pairs because I lost 1. Now buying a third cause I need a back up in case I forget my longest standing 1 at work. Or lose it. I bought the pair that I’m using and October and they are still perfect. Like I said I lost my first pair in a cab. Totally my fault. Now I have my back ups because I bought two. It makes me feel like the price is good enough that I would buy these for a few friends for presents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something's changed
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these headphones 7 times in almost as many years (some for work, some for home). Unfortunately for some reason only my oldest pair will stay plugged into my phone. The other headphones have no trouble with other devices, just the phone. I'm not sure what was changed about the jack, but it's made them unusable without physically holding it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Luxury Yacht

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable to wear, a nice change to having it 'in' the ear. I can wear these comfortably for hours. Sound quality is good with loud volume and good base. I now prefer these over my wireless full headphones or wireless earbuds. These are replacing the same set I purchased many years ago (they finally broke - pulled a wire out when I fell asleep with them on). I was so pleasantly surprised when I found them listed here. They're a great item at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable, but sound quality is minimal.
customer_reviews.text: I like these for sleeping. They're nice and flat against my pillow. The only problem is that the sound quality is just ok. Really not even good. But I mostly just listen to thunderstorm sounds so their low-fi sound is acceptable. They even survived my cat playing with then one day when I forgot to put them away, so pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Little Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these for years. They are fantastic. Especially for the price. They used to be $20-25. They've dropped now. Everyone in a while I'll lose a pair somewhere, or one I ruined by putting it through the wash. But other that than I've never had one break on me. I keep one at home, a pair in my car, and one at work. Cannot say enough good things about them.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Good for active people looking for inexpensive pair with decent audio quality
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable earbuds. They rest just outside your ear canal so there is nothing to "shove in." Because of the "hook" mechanism, they are good for light running and active users. The audio quality is similar to the ever-popular Panasonic RP-HJE120-K earbuds. I was enjoying these quite a bit until my daughter "borrowed them" when she went to college. The cable is a bit flimsy but otherwise, an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace my old hanger earphones I used for working out and these were a big disappointment. It really comes to comfort; the plastic hook just puts stress on my ear and the hook really doesn't make it snug. I have to constantly adjust them to make sure they aren't falling off and that just made me miss my old earphones with the rubber hook. Lastly, the jack is not long enough for my LG G2 phone and has frequently popped out. Addendum: I should note that my LG G2 has a thin Diztronic case on it. The "L" shaped headphone jack doesn't mesh well with the case's hole.
customer_reviews.author: C. Veresh

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and fit nicely
customer_reviews.text: I'm always loosing headphones! These were purchased as a Christmas present for my husband. I ended up wearing them just as much as he did. The cord didn't tangle terribly bad when I put them in my pocket to head to the gym. They fit both his bigger ear size and my smaller ear size great. They didn't slip or fall off during a sweaty workout I would purchase these headphones again.
customer_reviews.author: L Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I use these to listen to the tv and eventually fall asleep. So for that purpose they are superb. Really good high's but it does lack some bass. One reviewer says there is a small gap or small gap feel. There is a somewhat feeling of a gap but in my case I prefer it that way. It's that gap feeling were you lose the bass because it you press the headphones against your ears the bass sounds really good. The fit is a loose fit. You can workout with these on and they shouldn't fall off. They slide right on over your ears. The only bad thing is that they can't be adjusted. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy them, terribly uncomfortable...
customer_reviews.text: These suck, really uncomfortable, the stem seems too long, the earbud part is hard plastic and they dont feel secure at all. I like to wear a hat when I run in the cold weather and even the little bit of hat around my ears made them hurt so bad in my ears I couldnt even wear them for a minute. I only gave them them 2 stars b/c they actually make sound like they should, albeit sound equal to what they cost. Dont buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, good quality earphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought to listen to my music while cycling, hoping they would cut out the wind whistling in my ears as I build up speed. Didn't work as well as I had hoped, however they worked better than others I had used and I'm impressed how they stay on my ears when I'm working in my yard, etc. They stay on no matter if I'm bending over, reaching up, etc. They are extremely comfortable and so flat, you can sleep with them on, which I've never been able to do with any other earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, they've been my go to for a few years now as they never disappoint. They're comfortable and slim so it isn't noticable to others. The sound quality is great and it gets pretty loud while keeping the quality the same. They last pretty long, I wear them for multiple hours a day, often times even while sleeping and they've lasted me anywhere from 4-8 months. They last longer if you're more careful with them such as not tugging on it, not sleeping in them often and such but I do use them a bit exclusively hence why they break sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Szonja Barbara Kiss

customer_reviews.title: Decent but I would go for the koss or the Sony next time.
customer_reviews.text: These have a decent sound for the price, but overall it feels kinda cheap as it's not all that comfortable. I understand these are clip on over the ear but sound leaks out like crazy even when on...I lowered my volume less than half and ppl can still hear it. If u got the money try out the Sony or the koss as I've heard those have better sound and quality.
customer_reviews.author: SGP

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory- Just.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not particularly thrilled with these earphones. I bought these as a second set of clip on earphones, as my first pair, which I love, are aging. In comparison with my other ones (no longer on the market), these are lighter and cheaper feeling, the clips are less secure and the sound quality is just satisfactory. I have been using a pair of Sennheiser fold up earphones at work and they work quite nicely. In comparison, these sound much more high pitched and almost tinny. I won't return because they were pretty cheap, but I wouldn't recommend these before trying some of the similarly priced products out there first.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Works like it says it does
customer_reviews.text: I like these because they are very comfortable. I use them for several things I use it on the tv at dialysis I also use them on my phone and on my tablet. They work really well. Sound is great. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Payne

customer_reviews.title: Good choice!
customer_reviews.text: Regular ear buds fall out of my ears, I have tried several and for me the ones that go over my ear in the back are a better fit. Once in place, they stay there when I am on the treadmill and other machines at the gym. Color is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: HTOOOS

customer_reviews.title: Works great even after more than 2 years of use
customer_reviews.text: My 8-year old uses this all the time. He's a typical child that isn't always careful with his things, and this headset has survived for over 2 years. He likes that they are not earbuds that eventually become uncomfortable. The sound quality is fine for him (and me) for watching videos, playing games, etc.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal Mom

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is fine but I find them to be extremely uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I tend to destroy headphones, so I jumped the gun and bought 3 pairs of these at once. The sound quality is fine but I find them to be extremely uncomfortable. The earbud is hard plastic and won't stay comfortably secured. The hook is too large for my ear, even on the smallest setting, and the sharp pointed part at the top irritates the skin above my ear. One pair already stopped playing audio in the right earphone, after only a few uses. I wouldn't purchase again, but someone with a larger ear my find them to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: P&P15

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME "bed" phones. I use these listening to subliminals and the vocals are distinct and ultra clear and very affective. When i press them against my ears, they are twice awesome, so I went to the dollar store, bought a headband and glued speakers to headband so they are more pressed against my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A.

customer_reviews.title: NOT for people with small ears
customer_reviews.text: I am very petite with small ears and these do NOT fit at all. I can't keep them from coming out even though thry have chips, and they are hard plastic and very uncomfortable. I threw them away after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L. May

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound quality + sleep-optimal thinness + dirt cheap = one happy boi
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, it doesn't have a button I can accidentally press in my sleep, it doesn't make my ears hurt when I wake up, and they sound OK (though decent bass will only come through with some pressure on the earpiece). Good for working out as well, though I would avoid if you sweat excessively as I can't imagine these things are water resistant. Overall, the price is what makes these things 5 stars. If you want something more durable and better sounding, I'd aim for the $30+ bracket.
customer_reviews.author: SuwaShack

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I needed a cheap pair of headphones to wear at work which deliver sound and I don't like having buds in my ear hole all day. They work perfectly fine and are only a little uncomfortable on the ears after a long time, but I don't think that's completely avoidable-they aren't bad, sound is not top-notch catering to audiophiles of course.
customer_reviews.author: Edward and Elyse

customer_reviews.title: Good strong earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Strong and sturdy which is a plus compared to many of the flimsy earbud headphones I have purchased in the past. About the only thing I found wrong with them was due to their strong construction, they hurt my ears when I wear them with those big ear ear protection things when I mow the lawn. Which I have to think is probably not a deal breaker for most, but if you are planning to wear them like that, and you have delicate ears like me, you might want to re-think these.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nagy

customer_reviews.title: Really lightweight
customer_reviews.text: They work for what I need them too, Are use them for when I go for runs, I like to have one year free so I can listen to what’s going on around me. They are slim and very light weight so I can’t just keep the extra one on my shirt because it’ll fly off so I have to talk it in my bra so I don’t have it flying all over the place. Great delivery time
customer_reviews.author: Blitzfire

customer_reviews.title: Sound cuts out when moving
customer_reviews.text: I use headphones to listen to private audio files while doing chores and on the run. Had these less than a day and the sound kept cutting out. They feel cheap, flimsy and don't fit over the ear as comfortably as the discontinued RP-HS43 model that I love. Wish I'd kept the packaging for a return.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Finally found what works!
customer_reviews.text: I can't wear ear buds. I've tried them all! I love these light, slim clip on ear phones. They're so easy to clip on, stay in place and I don't even feel them. Finally, I can enjoy my earphones!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Lipsi

customer_reviews.title: simple affordable good headphone.
customer_reviews.text: i needed a cheap headphone to use w/my ipad to play games or watch videos or etc & not wake up the rest of the house. these do the job. nothing fancy, but definitely got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: R. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable if you're going to get sweaty.
customer_reviews.text: Good inexpensive earphones. Perfect for working out. For me, any earphone that goes in the ear is useless and gross at the gym. Once you get a drop of sweat in your ear, forget it. Ear buds slip out, and anything else (like over the head type of in-ear earphones) just feel gross. These do get a little sweaty, but it's not in your ear so you don't have a sweaty thing stuck in your ear. They are not really tight against your ear, so I don't know how much sound gets out - but the most comfortable ones I have found for working out.
customer_reviews.author: 21crosz

product_meta.title: Panasonic- Rp-hs46e-k Slim Clip On Earphone - Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Prior Generationpanasonic Rp-hs46 Clip Earphones 

Ultra Compact Compared To Many Clip Earphones, The Panasonic Rp-hs46 Clip Earphones Have Extremely Slim Housing, With A 30mm Driver Unit Offering Powerful Sound For Your Heavy Beats. Comfortable And Stylish In High Gloss, You Can Listen To Your Favourite Tunes In Style For As Long As You Want! 

manufacturer’s Description
The Panasonic Rp-hs46 Clip Earphones Are Designed To Give Excellent Sound Quality And Comfort. The 30mm Driver Unit Offers Powerful Sound While The Ergonomic Design Ear Hook Holds Securely And Comfortably. 

Not Only Do The Panasonic Rp-hs46 Clip Earphones Sound Great But With The Deluxe High Gloss Finish In Black Or White, They Look Fantastic Too.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars4,045 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
